lead_paragraph: Jamal Lewis is heading north without leaving the A.F.C. North. Lewis, a former 2,000-yard rusher for Baltimore, has agreed to a one-year deal with the Cleveland Browns. Lewis was released last week in a salary-cap move by the Ravens, who elected not to pay him a $5 million roster bonus. He will now try to buoy the Browns, who were last in the league in rushing in 2006.
